meanings.definition: Hafizes (noun): Plural form of hafiz, meaning a person who has memorized the entire Quran.
meanings.sent1: In the mosque, the hafizes gathered to recite the Quran together.
meanings.sent2: The hafizes in the community were respected for their dedication to memorizing the holy book.
meanings.sent3: The hafizes decided to have a friendly competition to see who could recite the Quran the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Their minds were like hafizes, storing every verse of the Quran with precision.
meanings.sent5: The young boy aspired to become one of the hafizes who could recite the Quran flawlessly.

meanings.definition: Hafizes (verb): Third person singular present form of hafiz, meaning to memorize the Quran.
meanings.sent1: She hafizes the verses every night before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: He hafizes the new chapters quickly due to his excellent memory.
meanings.sent3: The student hafizes the Quran while dancing to help remember the verses better.
meanings.sent4: Her mind hafizes the words like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The group hafizes together to support each other in memorizing the holy text.
